intro: Letestuella tisserantii, commonly known as the Tisserant's spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in complex structures called cyathia, which are typical of the spurge family. Letestuella tisserantii is often found in arid or semi-arid regions, demonstrating adaptability to harsh environmental conditions.
